1.question: What is the primary method used in the article to achieve strain in 2D semiconductors?

options.C: Thermal coefficient of expansion mismatch
options.D: Epitaxial growth
options.E: Laser heating

2.question: Which material is used as a model system in the study?

options.C: Graphene
options.D: BN
options.E: SiO2

3.question: What range of strain was achieved in the WSe2 samples?

options.C: 1% tensile to 0.2% compressive
options.D: 2% tensile to 1% compressive
options.E: 3% tensile to 2% compressive

4.question: What is the significance of the indirect-to-direct bandgap transition observed in the study?

options.A: It reduces the material's thermal conductivity.
options.B: It enhances the material's mechanical strength.
options.C: It improves the material's optical properties.
options.D: It decreases the material's electrical resistance.
options.E: It increases the material's density.

5.question: Which substrate is expected to produce compressively strained WSe2 samples?

options.C: Sapphire
options.D: Strontium titanate
options.E: Silicon

6.question: What is the role of the thermal coefficient of expansion (TCE) in the study?

options.A: To determine the electrical conductivity of the material
options.B: To control the strain in the synthesized 2D material
options.C: To measure the optical transparency of the substrate
options.D: To calculate the thermal stability of the material
options.E: To enhance the chemical reactivity of the substrate

7.question: What technique was used to quantify strain in the WSe2 samples?

options.C: Electron diffraction
options.D: Scanning tunneling microscopy
options.E: Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy

8.question: What is the effect of tensile strain on the photoluminescence (PL) of WSe2 monolayers?

options.C: It shifts the PL peak to higher energies.
options.D: It has no effect on the PL intensity.
options.E: It broadens the PL peak.

9.question: What is the primary challenge addressed by the strain-engineered growth method in the study?

options.C: Realizing built-in tensile and compressive strains
options.D: Enhancing chemical stability
options.E: Reducing thermal expansion

10.question: What is the significance of the Grüneisen parameter in the study?

options.A: It measures the thermal conductivity of the material.
options.B: It quantifies the shift in Raman peak due to strain.
options.C: It determines the electrical resistance of the material.
options.D: It calculates the optical absorption coefficient.
options.E: It assesses the mechanical strength of the substrate.

11.question: What is the effect of rapid quenching on the WSe2 samples?

options.A: It increases the sample's thermal stability.
options.C: It enhances the sample's electrical conductivity.
options.D: It reduces the sample's optical transparency.
options.E: It increases the sample's mechanical strength.

12.question: What is the observed effect of strain on the dark exciton in WSe2 monolayers?

options.B: Strain has no effect on dark excitons.
options.C: Strain brightens the dark exciton.
options.D: Strain reduces the energy level of dark excitons.
options.E: Strain causes dark excitons to disappear.

13.question: What is the primary advantage of using 2D transition metal dichalcogenides (TMDCs) in optoelectronics?

options.B: Naturally terminated surface without dangling bonds
options.C: Low electrical resistance
options.D: High mechanical strength
options.E: Low optical absorption

14.question: What is the role of potassium bromide (KBr) in the growth process?

options.A: It acts as a catalyst for the reaction.
options.B: It serves as a promoter for the growth.
options.C: It enhances the thermal stability of the substrate.
options.D: It increases the electrical conductivity of the material.
options.E: It reduces the optical absorption of the material.

15.question: What is the effect of growth temperature on the strain in WSe2 monolayers?

options.C: Higher temperatures increase tensile strain.
options.D: Growth temperature has no effect on strain.
options.E: Higher temperatures increase both tensile and compressive strain.

16.question: What is the observed effect of strain on the PL peak position of WSe2?

options.A: Strain shifts the PL peak to lower energies.
options.B: Strain shifts the PL peak to higher energies.
options.C: Strain broadens the PL peak.
options.D: Strain narrows the PL peak.
options.E: Strain has no effect on the PL peak position.

17.question: What is the primary method used to transfer WSe2 samples in the study?

options.C: HF based wet transfer technique
options.D: Thermal evaporation
options.E: Laser ablation

18.question: What is the impact of strain on the absorption spectrum of WSe2 monolayers?

options.A: Strain increases the absorption at all wavelengths.
options.B: Strain decreases the absorption at all wavelengths.
options.C: Strain red-shifts the A and B exciton resonances.
options.D: Strain blue-shifts the A and B exciton resonances.
options.E: Strain has no effect on the absorption spectrum.

19.question: What is the observed effect of low temperatures on the PL of strained WSe2 monolayers?

options.A: PL intensity decreases at low temperatures.
options.B: PL intensity remains constant at low temperatures.
options.C: PL intensity increases at low temperatures.
options.D: PL intensity fluctuates at low temperatures.
options.E: PL intensity is unaffected by temperature changes.

20.question: What is the primary conclusion of the study regarding strain engineering in 2D materials?

options.A: Strain engineering is not feasible in 2D materials.
options.C: Strain engineering allows for modulation of physical properties.
options.D: Strain engineering is only applicable to monolayer materials.
options.E: Strain engineering is limited to mechanical bending techniques.
